definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
complementary interval/addition musical interval adding to an octave

sentences.english: Intervals may be modified by the addition of signs for sharps, flats or naturals by the side of numerals.
sentences.chinese: 音程可以通過在數字旁添加升降或還原號來改變。

sentences.english: Dissonant intervals are the second and the seventh.
sentences.chinese: 不協和音程爲二度和七度。

sentences.english: Intervals may be inverted when the upper note is placed below the original lower note.
sentences.chinese: 把高音放置在原低音下時需要將音程轉位。
其他音程爲不協和音程。
其他音程爲不協和音程。

sentences.english: Non-western music produces a greater number of distinct tones within the same interval.
sentences.chinese: 非西方音樂在同一個音程中產生數量更多的不同音調。

sentences.english: It should be noticed that intervals are measured upwards.
sentences.chinese: 值得注意的是，音程是向上度量的。

sentences.english: This is, however, true of this octave of densities .
sentences.chinese: 然而，在這個八度音程宇宙中是真實的。

sentences.english: Teaching by method of tonic solfa, students built up interval aural ability.
sentences.chinese: 以首調唱名法進行教學，有助於學生音程音感的建立。

sentences.english: Various conventions exist to indicate augmented or diminished intervals.
sentences.chinese: 存在各種不同習慣表示增或減音程。

definition: triad/musical chord of three notes, such as major triad do-mi-so
a note on a musical scale
tone mark on a Chinese syllable (i.e. accents on ā á ǎ à)/(music) key signature
names of the notes of a musical scale (e.g. C, D, E or do, re, mi)
